Content:: The Oval Office Study is the working office of the president of the United States. Located in the West Wing of the White House, it adjoins the Oval Office, the ceremonial office of the president. The Oval Office Study is one of a suite of rooms accessed from a small corridor outside the Oval Office, which includes the president's private lavatory and dining room.[1][2] George H.W. Bush speaks into a telephone in the Oval Office Study Barack Obama speaks into a telephone in the Oval Office Study Barack Obama in the Oval Office Study; the interior of the Oval Office can be seen through the open door Coordinates: 38°53′51″N 77°02′15″W﻿ / ﻿38.897370°N 77.037424°W﻿ / 38.897370; -77.037424
